required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Copanlisib in Relapsed/Refractory Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (DLBCL)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-arm Phase II Study in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (DLBCL) to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Treatment With Single Agent Copanlisib and the Impact of Biomarkers Thereupon.

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the potential efficacy (in terms of objective response) of single agent copanlisib in patients with relapsed or refractory Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) and assess the relationship between efficacy and a potentially predictive biomarker

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) in Total Population Based on Investigator Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The primary efficacy overall response assessment was based on investigator assessment of response.

primary_outcome.measure: ORR in Total Population Based on Investigator Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The primary efficacy overall response assessment was based on investigator assessment of response.

primary_outcome.measure: ORR by CD79b Status Based on Investigator Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The primary efficacy overall response assessment was based on investigator assessment of response.

primary_outcome.measure: ORR by DLBCL/COO Subtype Based on Investigator Assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
primary_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The primary efficacy overall response assessment was based on investigator assessment of response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DOR) in Total Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of response (DOR) was defined as the time from the date of first observed overall response (CR or PR) until radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. DOR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of response (DOR) was defined as the time from the date of first observed overall response (CR or PR) until radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. DOR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

DOR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment until death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment until death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment until death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Stable Disease (DOSD) in Total Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of stable disease (DOSD) was defined as the time (in days) from date of start of study treatment to radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. The DOSD was only evaluated in patients failing to achieve a best response of CR or PR, but who achieved SD (stable disease), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR) in Total Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The disease control rate (DCR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had a best response rating of CR, PR, or SD that was achieved during treatment or within 30 days after termination of study drug. The tumor response was based on investigator assessment according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The disease control rate (DCR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had a best response rating of CR, PR, or SD that was achieved during treatment or within 30 days after termination of study drug. The tumor response was based on investigator assessment according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The disease control rate (DCR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had a best response rating of CR, PR, or SD that was achieved during treatment or within 30 days after termination of study drug. The tumor response was based on investigator assessment according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment to 30 days after termination of study drug, assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies (whichever occurs first ), with an average of 15 weeks for individual patient
secondary_outcome.description: A TEAE was defined as any event arising or worsening after the start of study drug administration until 30 days after the last application.

other_outcome.measure: Time to Response (TTR) in Total Population
other_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient's first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
other_outcome.description: The time to response (TTR) was defined as the time (days) from start of study treatment to the date of first observed response (first measured CR or PR). TTR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

other_outcome.measure: ORR in Total Population Based on Central Imaging Review
other_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
other_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The overall response assessment for this outcome measure was based on central imaging review.

other_outcome.measure: ORR by CD79b Status Based on Central Imaging Review
other_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
other_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The overall response assessment for this outcome measure was based on central imaging review.

other_outcome.measure: ORR by DLBCL/COO Subtype Based on Central Imaging Review
other_outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)
other_outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The overall response assessment for this outcome measure was based on central imaging review.

arm_group.description: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946) solution for IV infusion (test drug/investigational medicinal product)

intervention.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) (de novo or DLBCL transformed from follicular lymphoma on the basis of a tissue biopsy).
- Received at least one prior therapy for aggressive Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma (NHL) (DLBCL).
- Received CHOP + rituximab or equivalent regimen.
- Patients must have measurable disease.
- Not eligible or not willing to receive the high-dose (myeloablative) chemotherapy (HDC) and SCT.
- A fresh tumor biopsy collected during screening and /or archival tumor tissue collected after the last relapse/disease progression.
- ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status (PS) ≤ 2.
- Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥ the lower limit of normal (LLN) for the Institution. (as per local standard of care) as measured by echocardiogram (ECHO) or Multiple gated acquisition (MUGA) scan.
- Adequate bone marrow, liver and renal function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any of the following as the only site(s) of disease: palpable lymph nodes not visible on imaging studies, skin lesions, or bone marrow involvement only.
- Active CTCAE (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events) Grade 3/4 infection.
- Current central nervous system (CNS) involvement by lymphoma.
- Unstable angina (angina symptoms at rest), new-onset angina (begun within the last 3 months). Myocardial infarction within the past 6 months before start of study treatment.
- Uncontrolled arterial hypertension despite optimal medical management (per investigator's opinion).
- Type I or II diabetes mellitus with HbA1c > 8.5% at Screening.
- New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III or IV heart disease.
- History or concurrent condition of interstitial lung disease of any severity and/or severely impaired lung function (as judged by the investigator).
- Patients who previously received therapy with copanlisib or other PI3K inhibitors are not eligible for enrollment.

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 32 centers across 10 countries, between 08 MAY 2015 (first subject first visit) and 21 FEB 2017 (2nd database cut-off date).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 91 subjects were screened, of which 67 were assigned to study treatment and also started the treatment, and 24 were screened but never assigned to treatment. Altogether 27 patients were excluded from the per protocol set, which comprised 40 patients.

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

participants_list.participants: Reasons for completion in this period included death (2), PD and lack of efficacy (1).
This period excludes 2 deaths on treatment and 10 subjects entering active follow-up
14 subjects were considered completed due to death.
This period incorporates safety follow-up with radiological assessments
Reasons for completion in this period included death (2) and PD.
21 patients discontinued from treatment didn't enter due to withdrawal by subject(3) and death(18)
Reason for completion in this period was death.

group.title: CD79b Mutant
group.description: Included all CD79b mutant patients classified at baseline depending on the biomarker value.

group.description: Included all CD79b wild-type patients classified at baseline depending on biomarker value.

analysis.estimate_desc: ORR difference: ORR in CD79b mutant subgroup minus ORR in CD79b wild-type subgroup

group.title: Activated B-cell-like (ABC)
group.description: Included all patients with activated B-cell-like (ABC) DLBCL classified at baseline depending on the biomarker value.

group.title: Germinal Center B-cell-like (GCB)
group.description: Included all patients with germinal center B-cell-like (GCB) DLBCL classified at baseline depending on the biomarker value.

group.title: Unclassifiable
group.description: Included all patients with unclassifiable DLBCL/COO subtype at baseline.

measure.title: ORR by DLBCL/COO Subtype Based on Investigator Assessment
measure.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The primary efficacy overall response assessment was based on investigator assessment of response.

analysis.estimate_desc: ORR difference: ORR in ABC subgroup minus ORR in non-ABC group (i.e. combined GCB subgroup and Unclassifiable subgroup)
ORR difference: ORR in GCB subgroup minus ORR in non-GCB subgroup (i.e. combined ABC subgroup and Unclassifiable subgroup)
ORR difference: ORR in Unclassifiable subgroup minus ORR in ABC / GCB subgroup (i.e. combined ABC subgroup and GCB subgroup)

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DOR) in Total Population
outcome.description: The duration of response (DOR) was defined as the time from the date of first observed overall response (CR or PR) until radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. DOR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

outcome.population: Responders (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR) in full analysis set based on the investigator assessment

group.description: Included all patients with missing DLBCL/COO subtype classified at baseline.

measure.title: PFS by DLBCL/COO Subtype
measure.description: The progression-free survival (PFS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment to radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier, based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS) in Total Population
outcome.description: The overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment until death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient’s first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first

measure.title: OS by DLBCL/COO Subtype
measure.description: The overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of start of study treatment until death from any cause.

outcome.title: Duration of Stable Disease (DOSD) in Total Population
outcome.description: The duration of stable disease (DOSD) was defined as the time (in days) from date of start of study treatment to radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. The DOSD was only evaluated in patients failing to achieve a best response of CR or PR, but who achieved SD (stable disease), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient’s first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Patients who failed to achieve CR or PR but achieved SD in full analysis set based on the investigator assessment

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

measure.title: Duration of Stable Disease (DOSD) in Total Population
measure.description: The duration of stable disease (DOSD) was defined as the time (in days) from date of start of study treatment to radiological PD or death due to any cause, whichever was earlier. The DOSD was only evaluated in patients failing to achieve a best response of CR or PR, but who achieved SD (stable disease), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.
measure.population: Patients who failed to achieve CR or PR but achieved SD in full analysis set based on the investigator assessment

outcome.title: Disease Control Rate (DCR) in Total Population
outcome.description: The disease control rate (DCR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had a best response rating of CR, PR, or SD that was achieved during treatment or within 30 days after termination of study drug. The tumor response was based on investigator assessment according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient’s first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
outcome.description: A TEAE was defined as any event arising or worsening after the start of study drug administration until 30 days after the last application.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment to 30 days after termination of study drug, assessed up to 2 years after the last patient’s first treatment or the last patient dies (whichever occurs first ), with an average of 15 weeks for individual patient

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment-emergent Serious Adverse Events (TESAEs)
measure.description: A TEAE was defined as any event arising or worsening after the start of study drug administration until 30 days after the last application.

outcome.title: Time to Response (TTR) in Total Population
outcome.description: The time to response (TTR) was defined as the time (days) from start of study treatment to the date of first observed response (first measured CR or PR). TTR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 2 years after the last patient’s first treatment or the last patient dies, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Responders (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR) in full analysis set based on the investigator assessment

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

measure.title: Time to Response (TTR) in Total Population
measure.description: The time to response (TTR) was defined as the time (days) from start of study treatment to the date of first observed response (first measured CR or PR). TTR was defined for responders only (i.e. patients with CR or PR), based on the investigator assessment of tumor response according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT.
measure.population: Responders (i.e. patients with a best response of CR or PR) in full analysis set based on the investigator assessment

outcome.title: ORR in Total Population Based on Central Imaging Review
outcome.description: The objective response rate (ORR) was defined as the proportion of patients who had at least one post-baseline overall response of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) during study conduct according to the criteria defined by the Lugano Classification, 2014 and assessed by CT/MRI/PET-CT. The overall response assessment for this outcome measure was based on central imaging review.
outcome.time_frame: From start of study treatment assessed up to 24 weeks after the last patient fully evaluable for the primary endpoint started treatment (about 12 months)

group.title: Copanlisib (BAY80-6946)
group.description: Patients assigned to receive copanlisib intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose of 60 mg as single agent on Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day treatment cycle. Copanlisib treatment was to be continued until disease progression (PD), unacceptable toxicity, or until another criterion was met for withdrawal from the study treatment.

The overall response assessment for this outcome measure was based on central imaging review.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
